author: Staff Reporter
text:
All arrangements have been put in place for the Attukal Pongala festival at the Attukal Bhagavathi Amman Temple in Thiruvananthapuram, beginning on February 23.

Addressing reporters here on Thursday, General Convenor for the festival Ravindran Nair and Publicity Committee Convenor Shoba Chandrasekar said that around 40 lakh devotees were expected to offer Pongala to the presiding deity of the temple, within a six-kilometre radius of the temple.

While the preparations for the offering would begin at 10.30 a.m. on that day, the ‘Nivedyam’ would be done at 1.30 p.m.

Cutting across caste and creed, 35 lakh women participated in the festival last year and it was expected that the figure would touch the 40-lakh mark this year, the convenors said.

More than 1,000 priests would be present for sprinkling the ‘theertha,’ while hundreds would participate in the ‘Kutthiyottam’ rituals by various groups. The Purathezhunnallippu procession would have around 10 art forms and floats with the Attukal Bhagavathi’s ‘thidambu’ (replica) to be carried by the elephant.

A festival committee with 111 members have been constituted to ensure the smooth conduct of the festival, the convenors said.
title: 40-lakh devotees likely to take part in Attukal festival
